Title: Senior Data Visualization Specialist (Healthcare Data)
Description:
Interwell Health is a kidney care management company that partners with physicians on its mission to reimagine healthcare—with the expertise, scale, compassion, and vision to set the standard for the industry and help patients live their best lives. We are on a mission to help people and we know the work we do changes their lives. If there is a better way, we will create it. So, if our mission speaks to you, join us!

We are looking for a versatile and detail-oriented Senior Data Visualization Specialist to join our Healthcare Data Analytics team. In this role, you will transform complex healthcare data into compelling visual narratives to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. You will collaborate closely with your Interwell Health colleagues and stakeholders to understand analytical needs, design engaging visual solutions, and deliver insights through storytelling. Your expertise will enhance how we interpret, present, and act on healthcare data, making your work crucial in translating analytics into impactful visual communication.

What you'll do:


Design and Develop Visualizations: Create advanced data visualizations and dashboards that translate complex data into actionable insights. Leverage industry-leading tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent visualization software to present key findings.
Lead Visualization Strategy: Act as a thought leader in data visualization by shaping the team's approach to visual storytelling and presentation. Guide the selection of visualization tools, methods, and frameworks that best serve the organization's strategic goals.
Data Storytelling: Build visual narratives that clearly communicate business insights, using design and layout principles to optimize clarity and engagement for diverse audiences.
Stakeholder Partnership and Influence: Engage with senior stakeholders to understand business needs at a strategic level, translating high-level requirements into actionable data visualization solutions that drive business impact. Advocate for data-driven decision-making by educating and empowering stakeholders to use visual insights effectively.
Ensure High Standards and Consistency: Set and maintain quality standards for the team's visualization work, conducting in-depth code reviews, offering constructive feedback, and ensuring alignment with organizational standards and goals.
Proactively Identify Opportunities for Improvement: Independently seek out opportunities to improve data visualization processes, tools, and techniques. This includes optimizing dashboard performance, enhancing user experience, and exploring new data visualization innovations.
Knowledge Sharing and Mentoring: Lead team sessions on best practices in data visualization, share advanced techniques with colleagues, and contribute to the team's visualization knowledge base.


What you'll need:


5+ years of experience in data visualization, business intelligence, or data analytics, with demonstrated experience leading projects and influencing decision-making within an organization.
Advanced expertise in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and deep proficiency in SQL for complex data manipulation, ETL, and optimization of visualizations.
Strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to align visualizations with broader organizational goals and to anticipate stakeholder needs.
Experience in mentoring and training junior team members, with a strong commitment to knowledge sharing and team development.
Leadership in design and data visualization standards, including the ability to create guidelines for visual consistency, accuracy, and accessibility across all visualizations.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to influence, negotiate, and build consensus at senior levels, representing data visualization as a key driver of business insights.

You will collaborate closely with your Interwell Health colleagues and stakeholders to understand analytical needs, design engaging visual solutions, and deliver insights through storytelling. Your expertise will enhance how we interpret, present, and act on healthcare data, making your work crucial in translating analytics into impactful visual communication.

What you'll do:

  • Design and Develop Visualizations: Create advanced data visualizations and dashboards that translate complex data into actionable insights. Leverage industry-leading tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or equivalent visualization software to present key findings.
  • Lead Visualization Strategy: Act as a thought leader in data visualization by shaping the team's approach to visual storytelling and presentation. Guide the selection of visualization tools, methods, and frameworks that best serve the organization's strategic goals.
  • Data Storytelling: Build visual narratives that clearly communicate business insights, using design and layout principles to optimize clarity and engagement for diverse audiences.
  • Stakeholder Partnership and Influence: Engage with senior stakeholders to understand business needs at a strategic level, translating high-level requirements into actionable data visualization solutions that drive business impact. Advocate for data-driven decision-making by educating and empowering stakeholders to use visual insights effectively.
  • Ensure High Standards and Consistency: Set and maintain quality standards for the team's visualization work, conducting in-depth code reviews, offering constructive feedback, and ensuring alignment with organizational standards and goals.
  • Proactively Identify Opportunities for Improvement: Independently seek out opportunities to improve data visualization processes, tools, and techniques. This includes optimizing dashboard performance, enhancing user experience, and exploring new data visualization innovations.
  • Knowledge Sharing and Mentoring: Lead team sessions on best practices in data visualization, share advanced techniques with colleagues, and contribute to the team's visualization knowledge base.

What you'll need:

  • 5+ years of experience in data visualization, business intelligence, or data analytics, with demonstrated experience leading projects and influencing decision-making within an organization.
  • Advanced expertise in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and deep proficiency in SQL for complex data manipulation, ETL, and optimization of visualizations.
  • Strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to align visualizations with broader organizational goals and to anticipate stakeholder needs.
  • Experience in mentoring and training junior team members, with a strong commitment to knowledge sharing and team development.
  • Leadership in design and data visualization standards, including the ability to create guidelines for visual consistency, accuracy, and accessibility across all visualizations.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to influence, negotiate, and build consensus at senior levels, representing data visualization as a key driver of business insights.

Title: Sr. Data Engineer I (5540)
Description:
As Sr. Data Engineer I, you’ll take a leadership role in architecting, building, and optimizing our data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes. Your deep technical expertise and extensive experience will drive the development of scalable, efficient, and reliable data solutions that empower our analytics and business intelligence initiatives. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams including data scientists, analysts, and software engineers to ensure our data ecosystem meets both current and future requirements.




We know that you can’t have great technology services without amazing people. At MetroStar, we are obsessed with our people and have led a two-decade legacy of building the best and brightest teams. Because we know our future relies on our deep understanding and relentless focus on our people, we live by our mission: A passion for our people. Value for our customers.




If you think you can see yourself delivering our mission and pursuing our goals with us, then check out the job description below!




What you’ll do:





Lead the design and implementation of complex, end-to-end data pipelines to collect, process, and transform data from various sources into usable formats.


Develop and maintain ETL/ELT processes to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability for downstream applications.


Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand data requirements and assist in the creation of data models, dashboards, and visualizations.


Optimize data infrastructure for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness, making use of both traditional relational databases and modern big data technologies.


Ensure data security and compliance with relevant data protection regulations throughout the data lifecycle.


Identify and resolve data-related issues, troubleshoot performance bottlenecks, and provide timely support to maintain data operations.


Mentor and guide junior data engineers, providing technical leadership and fostering a culture of continuous learning.





What you’ll need to succeed:





Possess an active U.S. Government issued Secret security clearance.


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.


Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in data engineering, with a proven track record of designing and implementing robust data solutions.


Expertise in building and maintaining data pipelines using tools such as Talend.


Experience implementing data integration within tools such as Pentaho.


Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, Scala, or SQL for data processing and manipulation.


Proficiency in working with CI/CD (e.g. Jenkins) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) to deploy data platforms such as Talend and Pentaho.


Experience with data warehousing solutions and data modeling concepts.


Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development practices.


Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to tackle complex technical challenges.


Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and present technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.





Like we said, we are big fans of our people. That’s why we offer a generous benefits package, professional growth, and valuable time to recharge. Learn more about our company culture code and benefits. Plus, check out our accolades.

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Solutions Engineer, Direct Analytics, Converse (Open to ATL, Beaverton, BOS)
Description:
Who You’ll Work With



You will work hand-in-hand with data engineers, other solutions engineers, and Direct Analytics team members and with a variety of dedicated Nike partners. You will join a highly motivated team that will be a driving force in building Data and Analytic solutions for the Converse Direct organization.



Who We Are Looking For



We are open to candidates in Atlanta, Beaverton or Boston area.



On the Converse Tech team, we seek individuals that have:



A solid understanding of our business; an understanding of how we create and move product, and how we serve customers
An agile mindset; familiarity with delivery within an agile framework
People leadership; managing with courage and acting with integrity and honesty and creating an environment of inclusion and trust while holding yourself and others accountable
Cross functional collaboration and stakeholder management with the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Technical literacy; a foundational understanding of critical technology concepts
An analytical mindset: the ability to acquire, visualize and analyze data to inform decisions; The ability to formulate and test hypotheses



Skills & Qualifications:



Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education, experience or training
Minimum 5 years relevant work experience
Experience working with analytic tools and languages such as Tableau, Sigma, SQL, R, VBA, Python, etc
Experience working with large data sets and complex data models; business analytics background preferred
Intermediate SQL knowledge required
Experience working closely with a team of data engineers, and collaborating and managing relationships with business partners
Understanding Agile principles and methodologies and how they’re applied
Able to solve complex problems and take a new perspective on existing solutions
Able to respond to and prioritize changing demands and work independently through ambiguity
Strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to influence others internally and externally
Passion for contributing to a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging



What You’ll Work On



As a Senior Data & Analytics Solutions Engineer on the Converse Enterprise Data & Analytics Technology team, you will drive the creation, improvement, and adoption of Converse’s data products. You will focus on delivering scalable analytics solutions that create business value for our Converse Direct organization by defining product increments that meet both stakeholder and technology needs.



Work with the Data Engineering squad to ensure data products are integrated into the existing data architecture, communicate the vision to stakeholders, and help drive self-service analytics across the organization
Contribute to the analytics product roadmap, highlight risks and dependencies
Own, maintain and prioritize the data engineering product backlog; facilitate requirements gathering & scoping exercises, define acceptance criteria, ensure capacity for the right work at the right time
Ensure the readiness of the work, accept or reject work results, and that the work is aligned to fiscal year priorities and internal data management standards
Prioritize and make trade-offs based on understanding of strategies, epics, enabler requirements, defects, dependent teams, goals and the value features and stories bring to customers and the business
Assist in removing roadblocks for the data engineering squad
Work with the data engineering squad to ensure all stories are supported, clear, and delivered in high quality
Understand level of customer satisfaction and adoption of data products, and provide suggestions for improvements
Build and maintain end user documentation to support data governance initiatives



We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees and job applicants. We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

Title: Assistant Staff - Data Analyst and Machine Learning Researcher
Description:
The Interceptor and Sensor Technology Group is dedicated to advancing sensor and interceptor technologies for future surveillance, missile defense, and air defense systems. Our multidisciplinary team is currently engaged in the development of next generation capabilities for air, missile, and hypersonic defense architectures. Particular focus is given to assessing adversary capabilities and researching novel technologies in the context of the defense kill chain. In addition, concepts will be prototyped, tested, and matured in support of Department of Defense efforts.

Job Description

Data Analyst and Machine Learning Researcher

We are seeking a talented analyst to join a team supporting a portfolio of programs focused on data analysis, threat assessment, and algorithm development. In this role, the candidate will support the analysis of experimental data leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) and physics-based techniques.

Key Responsibilities:


Work with a diverse and highly collaborative team to develop, research, and analyze concepts for next-generation defense technology solutions.
Assess adversary capabilities to inform defense requirements
Analyze laboratory, ground, and flight data to draw out insights to inform technology development and government acquisition strategies.
Integrate with algorithm and AI/ML research programs and develop tools and applications for next-generation defense capability. Some focus areas include:
Physics-informed machine learning
Computer vision, 2-D to 3-D object reconstruction, pose estimation
Sensor data/signal interpretation, e.g., Radar, Infrared, etc.
Bayesian techniques, e.g. Simulation-Based Inference
Model optimization and fitting
Benchmark and assess algorithm performance in the context of Warfighter needs and the missile and hypersonic defense kill chain.
Communicate findings and progress with technical and non-technical audiences, including peers and sponsors.



Desired Qualifications:


Proven analytical skills as evidenced in academic research or internship projects.
Extensive experience analyzing experimental data.
Experience in interpreting real-world sensor measurements.
Experience applying AI/ML to data analysis (e.g. time-series, imagery)
Familiarity with industry-standard AI/ML implementations (e.g. CUDA)
Demonstrated programing skills in MATLAB, Python, R, or C++
Demonstrated ability to solve technical problems both individually and as part of a team
Capability to set and achieve personal and project goals in a timely manner.
Significant initiative and ability to perform independent research, set, and meet critical milestones.



Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in Physics, Data Science, Computer Science, Aerospace Engineering, or Mathematics.
Minimum GPA of 3.7.
If you’re driven by innovation and eager to work in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply and be part of our pioneering efforts in defense technology.

Title: Quality Engineer Data Analytics
Description:
Job Title
Quality Engineer Data Analytics

Job Description

Quality Engineer Data Analytic Engineers are responsible for enabling decision making by exploring the data, recommending actionable insights and building visualizations and dashboards.

Your role:

Understand end user/customer needs, business requirements and the context to interpret datasets correctly and gives recommendations towards business stakeholders and generates business insights to provide clear directions/actions to senior managers supporting decision making
Performs predictive data analysis, to generate actionable insights, manages and ensures data quality, integrity, normalization and accuracy of datasets from multiple sources
Design and manage the reporting environment, including data sources, security and metadata, and builds the platform to drive efficiency and consistency in providing data insights by consolidating data and methods.
Keeps abreast of technical knowledge by studying and implementing state-of-the-art techniques and development tools, participating in educational opportunities, participating in communities of practice, reading professional publications and maintaining personal networks
Support the Quality System and Functions in data requests to meet their functional needs.


You're the right fit if:

You have acquired 1+ years of relevant working in data acquisition and analysis project. Experienced with database management, Data Warehousing, statistical analysis & data interpretation.
You have experience performing specialized data analysis, operating within established procedures and practices with oversight from leads and management. Demonstrated ability to learn and understand business, product (or service) customers and/or users and generates insights and solutions accordingly. Experience identifying key issues and patterns from (partial) conflicting data and finding solutions on the basis of theoretical and practical insights and experience for deviating situations.
Your skills include a good understanding of the Quality System Regulations (ISO 9001, ISO 13485, 21 CFR Part 803, 806 & 820) and knowledge of medical device process requirements.
You have a Bachelor In Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology, Biomedical Engineer, Business Management, Science, Mathematics or equivalent related experience.
You must be able to successfully perform the following minimum Physical, Cognitive and Environmental job requirements with or without accommodation for this position.
You’re accountable to challenge requirements and come up with multiple options to get to more value. You have excellent communication skills and ability to present information and insights to internal stakeholders.


How We Work Together

We believe that we are better together than apart. For our office-based teams, this means working in-person at least 3 days per week. Onsite roles require full-time presence in the company’s facilities. Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.

This role is an onsite role based in Cambridge, MA.

About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.


Learn more about our business.
Discover our rich and exciting history.
Learn more about our purpose.
Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.


Philips Transparency Details
The pay range for this position in Cambridge, MA is $63,504 to $108,864

The actual base pay offered may vary within the posted ranges depending on multiple factors including job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity.  

In addition, other compensation, such as an annual incentive bonus, sales commission or long-term incentives may be offered. Employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive Philips Total Rewards benefits program, which includes a generous PTO, 401k (up to 7% match), HSA (with company contribution), stock purchase plan, education reimbursement and much more. Details about our benefits can be found here.

Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. For this position, you must reside in or within commuting distance to Cambridge, MA.
